TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit RowDefinition extends System.Windows.Controls.DefinitionBase

Docs.summary: Defines row-specific properties that apply to elements.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You must set a RowDefinition for each row in a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Grid>. When you set a row-specific RowDefinition, you assign unique sizing properties to each row.
To set a group of RowDefinition elements by using code, add the RowDefinition to a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.RowDefinitionCollection>.
The RowDefinition class exposes only height properties. To set width properties in a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Grid>, create an instance of <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinition>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
Gets a value that represents the calculated height of the .
Docs.value: A <xref:System.Double> that represents the calculated height in device independent pixels. The default value is 0.0.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When you use these values in the same code example, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.RowDefinition.MinHeight%2A> value takes precedence over the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.RowDefinition.MaxHeight%2A> value, which in turn takes precedence over the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.RowDefinition.Height%2A> value.
When you add or remove rows or columns, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinition.ActualWidth%2A> for all <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinition> elements and the ActualHeight of all <xref:System.Windows.Controls.RowDefinition> elements becomes zero until <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.Measure%2A> is called.

Docs.summary: Gets the calculated height of a element, or sets the value of a row that is defined by the .
Docs.value: The that represents the height of the row. The default value is 1.0.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The default is . When you use these values in the same code example, the value takes precedence over the value, which in turn takes precedence over the Height value. When you add or remove rows or columns, the for all elements and the of all elements becomes zero until is called. ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.DependencyProperty HeightProperty

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that represents the maximum height of a .
Docs.value: A <xref:System.Double> that represents the maximum height.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When you use these values in the same code example, the value takes precedence over the MaxHeight value, which in turn takes precedence over the value. When you add or remove rows or columns, the for all elements and the of all elements becomes zero until is called. ## XAML Attribute Usage ``` - or - ``` ## XAML Values *double* String representation of a value equal to or greater than `0.0034` but equal to or less than `160000`. An unqualified value is measured in device independent pixels. Strings need not explicitly include decimal points. *qualifiedDouble* A *double* value as described above, (excepting `Auto`) followed by one of the following unit specifiers: `px`, `in`, `cm`, `pt`. `px` (default) is [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_dipixel#plural](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] `in` is inches; 1in==96px `cm` is centimeters; 1cm==(96/2.54) px `pt` is points; 1pt==(96/72) px ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.DependencyProperty MaxHeightProperty

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that represents the minimum allowable height of a .
Docs.value: A <xref:System.Double> that represents the minimum allowable height. The default value is 0.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When you use these values in the same code example, the MinHeight value takes precedence over the value, which in turn takes precedence over the value. When you add or remove rows or columns, the for all elements and the of all elements becomes zero until is called. ## XAML Attribute Usage ``` - or - ``` ## XAML Values *double* String representation of a value equal to or greater than `0.0034` but equal to or less than `160000`. An unqualified value is measured in device independent pixels. Strings need not explicitly include decimal points. *qualifiedDouble* A *double* value as described above, (excepting `Auto`) followed by one of the following unit specifiers: `px`, `in`, `cm`, `pt`. `px` (default) is [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_dipixel#plural](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] `in` is inches; 1in==96px `cm` is centimeters; 1cm==(96/2.54) px `pt` is points; 1pt==(96/72) px ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|

Docs.summary: Gets a value that represents the offset value of this .
Docs.value: A <xref:System.Double> that represents the offset of the row. The default value is 0.0.
